message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it deals with rumour detection in social media during breaking news. It also involves the use of machine learning techniques to learn from the sequential dynamics of reporting during breaking news. 

It could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it involves natural language processing techniques to detect rumours in social media. 

Additionally, it could belong to cs.SOC (Computational Social Science) as it deals with social media and its impact on news reporting. 

It may also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as it involves the detection of unverified information in social media. 

Finally, it could belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as it deals with the spread of false information and the need to flag unverified information to avoid its spread.
